official-title.#text: To require career and technical education for maritime careers.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 135(b) of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006/s:135/ss:b

header.#text: Career and technical education leading to maritime careers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006/s:135/ss:b/p:8

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , by striking the period at the end and inserting
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006/s:135/ss:b/p:9

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

provide career and technical education at the secondary level that leads to maritime careers,
			 including a career in marine construction, commercial diving and marine
			 salvaging, container sales, dredging, environmental, marine, or ship
			 engineering, marine and science research, maritime technology,
			 stevedoring, ship repair, trucking and towing and tug services, admiralty
			 or maritime legal services, the cruise industry, as a member of a ship
			 crew
			 (such as a captain, mate, seaman, or engineer), or as a member of the Navy
			 or

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4468 IH: Seafarers Educational Advancement Act
